conservation.chart_desc: The graph below shows conservation of metabolic pathways across percentage of total genomes in each pathogenic genus.

data.content: Our analysis tools and interactive visualizations allow users to highlight regions of genome loss or conservation and ultimately look for changes within the context of functional pathways. Pathways of interest can be identified using the Comparative Pathway Tool and then analyzed individually, or in selected sets, via the Comparative Pathway Heatmap and KEGG Map.
data.subtitle: PATRIC Data is Linked to Associated Biochemical Pathways
data.title: DLP-Pathways-Data

process.subtitle: How Do We Process and Clean Up Our Data?
process.title: DLP-Pathways-Process

tools.subtitle: Find and Analyze Pathways with PATRIC Tools
tools.title: DLP-Pathways-Tools

tools.content: Supports comparison of consistently annotated metabolic pathways across closely related or diverse groups of genomes and visualizes them using interactive KEGG maps and heatmaps. The heatmap view is an interactive visualization tool that provides an overview of the distribution of genomes across the set of EC numbers within a selected pathway.
tools.title: Comparative Pathway Tool

tools.content: Searches for proteins based on Enzyme Commission (EC) number, a numerical classification scheme for enzymes based on the chemical reactions they catalyze. Enter a keyword, a known EC number, and/or a recognized EC name to view all proteins with that specific annotation.
tools.title: EC Search

tools.content: Allows exploration of phylogenetic relationships using species- and genus-level coloring schemes. PATRIC’s phylogeny viewer also supports custom creation of genome groups, to be used as a basis for analysis in other PATRIC tools.
tools.title: Phylogeny Viewer

tools.content: Locates bacterial genomes within PATRIC based on genome names and/or associated genome metadata such as host name, isolation country, collection date and more.
tools.title: Genome Finder

tools.content: Supports searching for and locating genomes of interest based on various combinations of 61 different metadata fields. For instance, all genomes that have been isolated from humans, genomes related by phylogeny, or genomes related by lifestyle.
tools.title: Genome Metadata

workflows.content: Some species of Mycobacterium have been documented to be undergoing widespread gene loss as they adapt to an intracellular lifestyle.  See how we use PATRIC to highlight regions of genome loss or conservation and ultimately look for changes within the context of functional pathways.
workflows.title: Comparing Diverse Pathways

workflows.content: Data in PATRIC is organized in a similar fashion at various taxonomic levels throughout the website. Follow along in this Mycobacterium example and see what data is available and where to find it for your favorite organisms/genomes/genes.
workflows.title: PATRIC Data Organization Overview

workflows.content: This downloadable pdf contains screenshots and detailed step-wise instructions for locating data of interest, such as finding a particular gene, finding the pan-proteome for all Mycobacterium genomes using the Protein Family Sorter and Heatmap, and examining pathways across Mycobacterium using the Comparative Pathway Tool and Heatmap.
workflows.title: PATRIC for the Novice User: Mycobacterium

workflows.content: This downloadable pdf contains screenshots and detailed step-wise instructions for locating data of interest, such as finding a particular gene, finding the pan-proteome for all Brucella genomes using the Protein Family Sorter and Heatmap, and examining pathways across Brucella using the Comparative Pathway Tool and Heatmap.
workflows.title: PATRIC for the Novice User: Brucella

workflows.content: See how to use PATRIC tables and the Table Toolbar including sorting, downloading, analysis tools, creating persistent column customization, and saving items to your workspace.
workflows.title: Using PATRIC Tables

workflows.content: Find out more about PATRIC data, analysis tools, and functionality in our Frequently Asked Questions.
workflows.title: Frequently Asked Questions
